We'd love to hear eyewitness accounts, the history behind an article.", "AHSAA announces fall reclassification Along with Friday’s historic announcement by the Alabama High School Athletic Association (AHSAA) concerning its separation of public and private schools in championship competition, was the announcement of the organization’s reclassification for the next athletic calendar, 2026-27. The public schools will be divided into six classifications instead of the seven of recent years, while the private schools will have two classifications. As in the past, schools will be classified based on enrollment. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Please enable it in your browser settings. Representative_Docs: ['"The things they\'ve never had since Andrew Bogut" - Udonis Haslem believes Warriors need a true big man to get back on track As a subscriber, you can share up to 3 articles each month with friends for free. Just click “Gift this Article” on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. Different people are pointing at various things as the cause or causes of the Golden State Warriors\' struggles this season. Some say it\'s because they don\'t have a consistent second option behind Steph Curry. Others say it\'s because their young guys have not progressed as expected. While some believe it\'s Steve Kerr\'s coaching. Former Miami Heat captain Udonis Haslem thinks that the Dubs\' issues are rooted in the fact that they did not get what they were supposed to receive last offseason. No racism, sexism or any sort of -ism that is degrading to another p', "Kerr groups ready to help feed families cut off from SNAP due to shutdown Approximately 2,000 in Kerr County have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October. Although the federal government shutdown is interfering with the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program that helps millions of low-income families, Kerr County food assistance partners stand ready to fill the gap. In Kerr County, 2,013 households totaling 4,082 individuals have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October, according to the Texas Health and Human Services Department. The Tennessee Volunteers had a disappointing season after making their first College Football Playoff in 2024. The Volunteers, under the leadership of head coach Josh Heupel, finished the 2025 season with an 8-5 record. That was after being ranked as high as No. 11 in the country. However, the team struggled down the stretch, losing four of its final seven games. As a result, it is now focused on building a championship contender for the upcoming season. Name: 1_passed away_grandmother_jane_mother
Representative_Docs: ['Janet Marie Flores Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Janet Marie Flores passed away peacefully on November 21, 2025 at the age of 94 surrounded by the love of her family. Jan was born on October 31, 1931 in San Francisco to loving parents Alice Detour and Joseph Hettrick. Jan was a loving mother, grandmother and great grandmother who found her greatest joy in her family. She had a way of making people feel welcomed. She was kind, big hearted, extremely gracious and devoted to those she loved. Her presence will be deeply missed. Jan lived a long life traveling, playing golf, bunco with her friends and one of her greatest talents was to find a treasure at garage sales. In her final years she enjoyed playing penny slots at the casino. The last nine years Jan spent in the loving care of her daughter and son in law. A special thank you to her granddaughter Samantha for making her last days warm, comfortable and full of love. Jan survived by her daughter Tina Schilling (Michael), her grandchildren Michael (Marissa), Paul (Kacie), Samantha (Carlos), and her nine great grandchildren Jackson, Aubrey, Jordan, Mikey, Ellie, Luna, Ryder, Makayla and Stella. And her friends who will forever cherish her memory. Celebration', 'Tosca Theresa Pardini Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Tosca Theresa Pardini, beloved mother, Nonna, great grandmother, and cherished friend, passed away peacefully on Sunday, November 16, surrounded by the love of her family. On a dark, cloudy day, as the Frank Sinatra song “Fly Me to the Moon” played softly, a single ray of sunshine broke through and gently touched her beautiful face as she took her final breath with her family by her side. She was born at home in San Francisco on May 7, 1931, and she carried the spirit of the city with her throughout her life. Tosca later made her home in Ross, California, where she built a life centered on family, tradition, and enduring love. Tosca met the love of her life, Sergio Pardini, and they were married on February 17, 1952, at Saints Peter and Paul Church in North Beach. For sixty one adventure filled years they were inseparable and shared a deep devotion that guided their lives together. Known for her warmth, elegance, and quiet strength, Tosca created a home where everyone felt welcome. She was deeply proud of her Italian heritage and the traditions she lovingly passed down. Her kindness and grace touched all who knew her. Tosca loved traveling the world with Ser', 'Linda Sue (Jordan) Schlosser Birth: 1950 Death: 2025 Linda Sue (Jordan) Schlosser March 16, 1950-December 15, 2025 passed away peacefully surrounded by her family at her home in San Pancho, Mexico. Survived by her husband of 41 years, Phil Schlosser, her mother Gerry, daughter Kelly Noel, son Kevin Noel and wife Jennifer and her grandchildren Trevor and Lena. She was preceded in death by her father, Wayne Henry Jordan and brother Michael Wayne Jordan. Linda was born and raised in San Rafael, CA and graduated from Terra Linda High School. Linda loved sunshine, warm weather and travel. She was an outstanding cook and loved to entertain. Her great adventure was moving to Mexico, building a wonderful home filled with warmth, family, friends and great meals. She loved traveling throughout Mexico and Italy. Her family requests that gifts in lieu of flowers be made in Linda’s name to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. Forever deep in my soul, The memory of your love Fills my heart And I am never alone. Honor with Flowers In memory of Linda Sue Plant a Living Memorial In memory of Linda Sue']

Name: 2_family_family members_gifts_friendships
Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: I’m annoyed that friend, IRL, never comments or ‘likes’ my online posts Dear Eric: I have a friend I’ve known for four years. We all live in a 55+ community and have moved here from different areas of the country. We are a group of women who get together on a regular basis for outings. Over the past couple of months, I feel somewhat left out because of a couple of events I wasn’t included in. But what I’m trying to understand is why does she not “like” or comment on any of my Facebook posts when she’s all over everyone else’s with supportive and loving comments? Again, this is so silly, but I can’t help wondering why. When I look back at my posts, I noticed she has never acknowledged any of them, even for my birthday. We are still friends, we work with the same fundraising group, have dinner at each other’s house and get invited to the same events. This Facebook thing has got me confused and I don’t know what kind of friend she is so I’m getting uncomfortable around her. So now, what am I doing? Ignoring her posts, which makes me feel so stupid and juvenile. If I wasn’t part of this group, which I really like, I wouldn’t bother with her. Can you shed any light on her mindset? It’s really got me confused. – Friend Request Dear Friend: Even though social', 'Asking Eric: Can mom work through tension in son’s relationship with dad so they can celebrate special birthday? Dear Eric: My son is turning 40 on December 22. My husband and I are at a quandary as to how to celebrate him. There have been issues between my husband and him over things from his childhood. We did a special trip for his older brother when he turned 40 and would like to do something special for this son’s 40th as well. Our daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included. I understand that, but I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat. I love my son with all my heart, as I do all my children, and want his 40th birthday to be memorable in a positive way. Any suggestions? – Mom Who Wants to Celebrate Dear Mom: The issues your son and your husband are having may be an obstacle, but they aren’t insurmountable. And the thing that can get them on the path to resolution is the same thing that can get you answers about how to celebrate your son: open communication. It’s not within your purview to try to fix things between them, but you have your own relationship with your son and so I’d encourage you to reach out and tell him what you told me: you want to celebrate him, you know things are difficult, and you’re lookin', 'Asking Eric: After 6 years sober, man is frustrated by his family’s hold on their hurt and distrust Dear Eric: I’ve just turned 40 this past year. The last 15 years I was in a horrible drug addiction. I lied and hurt and did terrible things to a lot of people, especially my family. About eight years ago they officially disowned me. Understandable. I’ve cleaned up and got my act together six years ago. At first, I tried to force my way back into their lives, which all refuted. I lashed out, said horrible things and stopped trying to be in their lives. My mom will stop by on my birthday for 10 minutes or so and drop a card off at Christmas. As for my two older brothers and my father, it’s radio silence. I guess what I’m asking is, what do I do to fix this and fast, as I said I’ve turned 40 this year, my parents are both 70. Time is running out, and I couldn’t imagine living my life without some kind of acceptance from my father. Or knowing he did or does love me. My heart breaks at the thought, but this is a real pickle. How can I fix a problem when the ones I need to fix it with won’t talk to me? Do I just keep ignoring their existence and put on this façade that I don’t care to my wife and 4-year-old son? What picture am I painting to my son, as he’s been guilty by association yo']

Name: 4_actors_actress_cast_horror
Representative_Docs: ["AP Entertainment SummaryBrief at 3:08 p.m. EST Brendan Fraser's new horizons include 'Rental Family' and rental hedgehogs BEDFORD, N.Y. (AP) — “Rental Family” is Brendan Fraser’s first leading role since winning the best actor Oscar for “The Whale.” In it, the 56-year-old plays a struggling actor living in Japan who, out of desperation and curiosity, takes a job with an agency that hires out actors to fulfill roles in real people’s lives. In an interview, Fraser discusses his life since the Oscar win, his eye-opening experiences in Japan and what returning to the “Mummy” series means to him. His time in Japan included a visit to a hedgehog cafe. “Rental Family” opens Friday in theaters. Copyright 2025 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. Name: 5_surgical_hospital_memorial hospital_patients
Representative_Docs: ['VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Fraser Health said that it expects it to “go-live” later in the spring. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Health care workers pose in front of the da Vinci Xi System. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Surrey Memorial Hospital is one step closer to providing robotic-assisted surgery with the arrival of the da Vinci Xi Robotic Surgery system. It is expected to be used in surgeries in the spring. “With the aid of the da Vinci Xi system, we can expand minimally invasive thoracic and foregut surgery, and we can do operations with greater precision and accuracy,” says Dr Ahmad Ashrafi, regional division head and chief of thoracic surgery for Fraser Health. “Patients may experience quicker recovery times, and we can carry out more complex procedures right here in Surrey, using minimally invasive techniques. This advanced technology will also help us attract and retain top surgical talent at Surrey Memorial Hospital.” Construction is underway on an operating room', 'VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Name: 6_welfare_social security_benefits_jobs
Representative_Docs: ['How much will DWP benefits and pensions rise following the budget? Benefits Budget 2025 Child Benefit Department for Work and Pensions DWP Pensions PIP Rachel Reeves Universal Credit National government Personal Finance DWP benefits including Universal Credit, Child Benefit, PIP, Carer\'s Allowance, and the State Pension are to increase in April 2026 after Rachel Reeves announced higher payments in her budget speech today. Anyone who claims DWP benefits should be in line for an increase in the next financial year, as the chancellor laid out plans to help pensioners, disabled people, parents, low earners, carers and unemployed people keep up with rising costs. Addressing MPs, Ms Reeves said: "The broken welfare system that we inherited wrote off millions of people as too sick to work and we will reform that system so that it is a system that does not count the cost of failure, but one that protects people who cannot work and empowers those who can. "We have brought back face-to-face assessments for disability benefits. Those are the face-to-face assessments that the shadow chancellor (Sir Mel Stride) got rid of when he was work and pensions secretary and our changes we have made to Universal Credit will get 15,000 people back into work, a figure con', 'How much will DWP benefits and pensions rise following the budget? Name: 7_immigration_britain_immigrants_diversity
Representative_Docs: ['‘UK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US’ People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. The findings are said to show that a common narrative about Britain being more socially liberal than America does not ring true across all issues. The National Centre for Social Research also found Reform UK voters in Britain were more likely than supporters of President Donald Trump in the US to say immigrants living in their country without permission should not be allowed to stay. While seven in 10 supporters of Mr Trump felt this way, the figure was almost eight in 10 (79%) among Reform followers. The researchers said they wanted to “better understand how public attitudes in the UK compare with those in the US, and the extent of polarisation in the two countries”. Their survey found 42% of people in the UK think there should be legal efforts to deport immigrants living here without permission, compared with just a third (33%) in the US. While almost two-thirds (64%) of respondents in the US felt diversity strengthens society, only around half (49%) of the UK public agreed. Name: 8_museum_world largest_tourism_exhibition
Representative_Docs: ["Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world’s largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. World leaders, including monarchs, heads of states and governments, are set to attend the grand opening ceremony, according to the Egyptian presidency which touted the museum as “an exceptional event in the history of human culture and civilization.” The museum is one of the megaprojects championed by President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi since he took office in 2014. He has embarked on massive investments in infrastructure with the aim of reviving an economy weakened by decades of stagnation and battered by the unrest that followed the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. Preparations for the grand reveal have been shrouded in secrecy. The museum, which was opened for limited visits in recent years, has been closed for the past two weeks. The government has revamped the areas around t", "Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization CAIRO (AP) — Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world’s largest dedicated to a single civilization. Name: 9_dancing_chris_lorraine_departure
Representative_Docs: ["Alan Titchmarsh fans in tears as couple with '150 kids' have garden ruined in real time ITV fans couldn’t believe it when Alan Titchmarsh “ruined” a couple’s garden on Love Your Garden – especially after elderly couple Rob and Margaret Isdale had fostered more than 150 children over the past 45 years. Their “lovely” garden in Grantham featured on the show as Alan and his co-stars Katie Rushworth, David Domoney and Frances Tophill tried to transform it into something inspired by The Secret Garden. Initially, the space featured a large lawn area with a shed and concrete paving stones, surrounded by lush trees and greenery. Afterwards, it was transformed into a floral haven complete with a faux-ruined stone wall, stone paving stones leading in paths around the flowers, and wooden trellises around the side of the house. Read more: Meghan and Harry dealt huge blow over 'real reason' for royal Christmas snub Read more: Rock legend gives new health update after warning from doctor We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy Set Daily Express as a 'Preferred Source' to get quicker", 'Strictly Come Dancing fans have same complaint as La Voix withdraws from show \'Pointless!\' Strictly Come Dancing fans have been left with the same question after it was announced La Voix has withdrawn from the competition. During Saturday (November 22) night\'s show, the remaining contestants took to the dance floor at the iconic Blackpool Tower Ballroom. Before things kicked off for Blackpool Week, presenter Tess Daly informed viewers that the drag queen – real name Chris Dennis – would not be returning to the competition after sustaining a foot injury. She said: "We can confirm she has very sadly had to withdraw from the competition," before revealing there would be no elimination this weekend. But this has left fans wondering why Sunday night\'s show is still airing now that there is no dance-off. Taking to social media with their queries, one wrote: "So what’s the point of Sunday’s show when everything can be done tonight #Strictly?" Read more: Strictly pro says only one person can replace Craig Revel Horwood Read more: BBC Strictly viewers switch off as major star pulls out of show We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you\'ve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You', 'Strictly Come Dancing star breaks silence after concern fifth contestant would quit Strictly Come Dancing\'s Alex Kingston is poised to carry on with her dance adventure, putting to rest concerns she might have to withdraw due to injury. The 62-year-old actress had triggered concerns about a potential exit after her daughter disclosed a rib injury on social media, stating that her mother had endured the discomfort to participate in Saturday\'s programme. The Doctor Who legend, who has been dazzling audiences on the dance floor alongside partner Johannes Radebe, was swift to comfort her supporters that injuries were simply "part and parcel" of the Strictly experience, and she had absolutely no plans to retire her dancing shoes. Fleur East, host of Strictly spin-off It Takes Two, has now verified that Alex will return to the competition following last week\'s Blackpool special. Discussing their forthcoming performance, Fleur disclosed: "Alex and Johannes will be dancing a cha-cha-cha to Ring My Bell by Anita Ward." Name: 11_central bank_florence_meeting_italy
Representative_Docs: ['Florence Press Conference Confirms ECB Remains Comfortable in Its Good Place Even a change of scenery has done nothing to change the European Central Bank’s current wait-and-see stance. Florence, where the ECB met today for its only annual meeting outside of Frankfurt, is apparently also this ’good place’, the central bank’s well-known pseudonym for comfortably keeping interest rates on hold. ECB President Christine Lagarde even called it a ‘magnificent’ place – Florence, that is, not rates. The comments at the press conference confirmed once again that the ECB has no intention to leave its ‘good place’ any time soon. We had feared a rather uneventful press conference. What should we say? We hate to be right… Anyhow, here are a few interesting remarks made by Lagarde: On the ECB’s risk assessment, the introductory statement had the most remarkable change compared with September. Last month, the ECB had still talked about risks to the growth outlook that had become “more balanced”; today, it refrained from qualifying any balance of risk. Instead, the central bank had a somewhat more extensive list of upside and downside risks to the growth outlook. Lagarde even said that some of the downside risks had abated. When asked whether this was a sign of an upcoming', 'Florence Press Conference Confirms ECB Remains Comfortable in Its Good Place Even a change of scenery has done nothing to change the European Central Bank’s current wait-and-see stance. Name: 12_tvs_samsung_tv_monitor
Representative_Docs: ["Forget Micro RGB: I saw TCL's new SQD-Mini LED TV, and it's the model to beat at CES Follow ZDNET: Add us as a preferred source on Google. This year's CES is indisputably the Micro RGB show. Virtually every major TV manufacturer is incorporating the tri-colored pixel technology, as if the transparent TVs from last year are no longer cutting-edge. TCL has other plans. Also: CES 2026 news: Live updates on TVs, smart glasses, robots, and more we've seen so far The brand's new crown jewel TV of 2026 is the X11L, which features TCL's Super Quantum Dot (SQD) Mini LED panel, for which the company claims achieves 100 percent of the BT2020 color gamut. This is accomplished by pairing the SQD layer with a CSOT UltraColor Filter, as well as an Advanced Color Purity Algorithm. If that assembly of tech jargon doesn't tell you it's CES (or that TCL means business), then I don't know what will. Effectively, the X11L solves a major pain point with conventional Micro RGB TVs: color blooming, or color crosstalk. With Micro RGB TVs often emitting very bright light, certain colors can bleed into surrounding dark areas, reducing color accuracy. With the CSOT UltraColor Filter, TCL has significantly reduced these artifacts, rendering images that, to my fresh-off-a-plane eyes, appeared c", 'Samsung OLED 48S95H: New 48-inch and 165 Hz OLED TV revealed ahead of schedule with HDR10 Plus Advanced support Samsung has already teased plenty of devices on the eve of CES 2026. However, the trade show has decided to lift the lid on one of Samsung\'s forthcoming OLED Smart TVs. For context, Samsung listed numerous unreleased Smart TVs on its Parts Database over a month ago. Of those, CES has announced that the S95H is a 2026 Honoree in its Gaming & eSports category. Specifically, the trade show has signalled out a 48-inch variant that was missing from November\'s leak. Incidentally, last year\'s S95F only went as small as 55-inches (curr. $1,997 on Amazon). According to the listing, the S95H offers a 165 Hz refresh rate with VRR technology supported. Assuming a 4K resolution from the S95F series and the usage of HDMI 2.1 ports, a 165 Hz refresh rate would require the usage of Display Stream Compression (DSC) to output at its peak resolution and refresh rate simultaneously. Moreover, the new 48-inch Smart TV will support Samsung\'s new HDR10 Plus Advanced format. Pricing and availability are unknown for now; the full description provided by Samsung and CES is as follows: The Samsung OLED (S95H) is the world\'s most advanced 48" OLED TV for high-end gaming. Combining unparalleled brightness and', 'LG’s upcoming premium OLED TV could beat Mini-LED peak brightness The Korean television and display manufacturer LG Electronics is working on its next-generation OLED TV as part of the G-series, along with a new wallpaper TV. According to a Videocardz report, the OLED TV in question is the LG G6 Evo AI, a new RGB Tandem WOLED. The G6 will feature a new “Hyper Radiant OLED” panel with “Brightness Booster Ultra,” which provides up to 3.9x the brightness of a regular OLED TV. Now, the report also mentions “B6” as a reference point. Given that LG’s B-series OLED TVs (non-MLA, non-Evo) typically have a peak brightness of around 800 to 850 nits, a 3.9x increase over that would put the peak brightness of the upcoming LG G6 Evo AI between 3,120 and 3,315 nits. In addition to the increase in peak brightness, the G6 will also feature an improved anti-reflection layer, which could enhance viewing angles and reduce glare from bright ceiling lights, for an uninterrupted viewing experience. The same report claims that LG’s G6 OLED TV will be available across a variety of screen sizes, including 48, 55, 65, 77, 83, and 97 inches. Whether you want a modest 48-inch television for your bedroom, a massive 97-inch screen for your living room, or an in-house theater,']

Name: 13_africa_school students_south africa_tourists
Representative_Docs: ['Minnesota high schoolers prepare for once-in-lifetime learning trip to Africa ASHBY, Minn. — There are field trips and there are field trips. Students at Ashby High School are busy raising money and getting ready to pack their bags for a two-week learning experience in South Africa. ADVERTISEMENT When it is below zero, the main street in Ashby, Minnesota, is quiet. Fewer than 500 people call this Grant County town home, but lately the town is busy rallying around a group of high school students. In the basement of Peace Grue Lutheran in the middle of town, five high school students join veteran church quilters in tying quilts that the students will take on their trip to South Africa. "There is a reason the church ladies do this and not the guys," joked Kevin Fick, the girls\' weightlifting coach and organizer of the trip, of tying quilts the students will take with them as gifts. Five girls, along with Fick and four adult chaperones, will make the trip to Eastern Cape, South Africa, from Feb. 28 through March 10. Not as tourists, but to learn about conservation on another continent. "Not a lot of kids get to do this," said student Hadley Hokanson, student. They will work a sheep ranch, fish for sharks, harvest their own food, camp in the bushes and more.
